snippet: Chinese citizens have had to tread carefully in discussing Chen Guangcheng, the dissident who sought refuge at the United States Embassy.
abstract: Chinese citizens are forced to tread carefully when discussing online Chen Guangcheng, the blind human rights activist who sought refuge at the United States Embassy; China's government, which is struggling with its own political scandals, seeks to avoid official mention of the international diplomatic incident that has incited a global debate over the country's human rights policies.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and SHARON LaFRANIERE

lead_paragraph: Chinese citizens have had to tread carefully in discussing Chen Guangcheng, the dissident who sought refuge at the United States Embassy.

headline.seo: Chen Guangcheng Case Much Discussed in China, but Cautiously
headline.main: For Chinese, a Man in the News Is Much Discussed, if Not by Name
headline.print_headline: For Chinese, a Man in the News Is Much Discussed, if Not By Name

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
